Processor.name: ATSAML21G18B
Processor.description: Atmel ATSAML21G18B device: Cortex-M0+ Microcontroller with 256KB Flash, 32KB SRAM, 48-pin package (refer to http://www.atmel.com/devices/SAML21G18B.aspx for more)

Enum.name: EOC
Enum.description: Interrupt on end of comparison (single-shot mode only)

Enum.description: The output of COMPn is not routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.description: The synchronous output (including filtering) of COMPn is routed to the COMPn I/O port

BitField.name: GENCTRL
BitField.description: Generic Clock Generator Control Synchronization Busy bits

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Maximum Value of the Trace Buffer in SRAM

Enum.name: ER
Enum.description: Erase Row - Erases the row addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: WP
Enum.description: Write Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: EAR
Enum.description: Erase Auxiliary Row - Erases the auxiliary row addressed by the ADDR register. This command can be given only when the security bit is not set and only to the user configuration row.

Enum.name: WAP
Enum.description: Write Auxiliary Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register. This command can be given only when the security bit is not set and only to the user configuration row.

Enum.name: RWWEEER
Enum.description: RWW EEPROM area Erase Row - Erases the row addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: RWWEEWP
Enum.description: RWW EEPROM Write Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: LR
Enum.description: Lock Region - Locks the region containing the address location in the ADDR register.

Enum.name: UR
Enum.description: Unlock Region - Unlocks the region containing the address location in the ADDR register.

Enum.name: PBC
Enum.description: Page Buffer Clear - Clears the page buffer.

Enum.name: SSB
Enum.description: Set Security Bit - Sets the security bit by writing 0x00 to the first byte in the lockbit row.

Enum.name: WAKEONACCESS
Enum.description: NVM block enters low-power mode when entering sleep.NVM block exits low-power mode upon first access.

Enum.name: WAKEUPINSTANT
Enum.description: NVM block enters low-power mode when entering sleep.NVM block exits low-power mode when exiting sleep.

Enum.name: NO_MISS_PENALTY
Enum.description: The NVM Controller (cache system) does not insert wait states on a cache miss. Gives the best system performance.

Enum.name: LOW_POWER
Enum.description: Reduces power consumption of the cache system, but inserts a wait state each time there is a cache miss. This mode may not be relevant if CPU performance is required, as the application will be stalled and may lead to increase run time.

Enum.name: DETERMINISTIC
Enum.description: The cache system ensures that a cache hit or miss takes the same amount of time, determined by the number of programmed flash wait states. This mode can be used for real-time applications that require deterministic execution timings.

Enum.description: All power domains are powered OFF

Enum.description: All power domains are forced ACTIVE.

Enum.name: PD01
Enum.description: PD0 and PD1 power domains are linked

Enum.name: PD12
Enum.description: PD1 and PD2 power domains are linked

Enum.name: 3CK32

Enum.name: 32CK32
Enum.description: Input pin shall be active for at least 32 32kHz clock period.

Enum.name: 512CK32
Enum.description: Input pin shall be active for at least 512 32kHz clock period.

Enum.name: 4096CK32
Enum.description: Input pin shall be active for at least 4096 32kHz clock period.

Enum.name: 32768CK32
Enum.description: Input pin shall be active for at least 32768 32kHz clock period.

Enum.description: An interrupt/event is generated when a new counter cycle starts or a counter cycle ends
